questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with a painful hip after a fall. The X-ray shows a fracture of the femoral neck. What is the most important complication to be aware of?
What is the name of the procedure where a bone graft is taken from the iliac crest and used to fuse two vertebrae together?
questions.correct_answer: D. Anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF)

questions.text: A 45-year-old female with a history of long-term corticosteroid use presents with hip pain and limited range of motion. An MRI shows changes consistent with avascular necrosis of the femoral head. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate for early-stage avascular necrosis?
What is the most common type of shoulder instability?
A 40-year-old woman presents with a 2-year history of progressive knee pain and stiffness. She has a valgus deformity of the knee. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 12-year-old boy presents with a wrist injury after a fall. X-rays reveal a Salter-Harris type II fracture of the distal radius. What is the primary concern with this type of fracture?
A 60-year-old woman presents with a 6-month history of shoulder pain and weakness. She has a positive drop arm test. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man presents with a 2-day history of severe ankle pain and swelling after a sports injury. The X-ray shows a fracture of the lateral malleolus. What is the most important step in the initial management?
Idiopathic scoliosis is:

options.label: C
options.text: Lateral curvature with rotation of spine

questions.correct_answer: C. Lateral curvature with rotation of spine
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Lateral curvature with rotation of spine

questions.text: A 20-year-old athlete presents with a 2-day history of severe knee pain and swelling after a sports injury. The X-ray shows a fracture of the patella. What is the most important step in the initial management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF)

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents with a 1-year history of progressive wrist pain and stiffness. She has a history of repetitive strain injury. Finkelstein test is positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old girl presented in emergency department with elbow pain, swelling in the hand and elbow as well. She unable to move her elbow as it aggravates her pain and swelling. Her pulse was also feeble. An X-Ray was performed as given below. Identify the vessel probably ruptured.

A mother came to the OPD with her 2-year-old baby with deformity of the feet as shown in the image. What is most appropriate management?

A 50-year-old man presents with a 1-year history of progressive hip pain and stiffness. He has a history of hip replacement surgery 10 years ago and a positive hip aspiration. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents with knee pain after a basketball game. She reports feeling a "pop" in her knee, and it is now swollen and unstable. Lachmann test was positive. What is the most likely injury?
A 35-year-old male presents with hip pain and an inability to bear weight after a fall. X-rays show a displaced femoral neck fracture. What is the most appropriate initial management?
In a patient with gouty arthritis, strongly birefringent needle-shaped crystals with negative elongation in synovial fluid aspiration are composed of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Monosodium Urate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In gouty arthritis, the classic finding on synovial fluid analysis is: Needle-shaped crystals Negatively birefringent under polarized light Show yellow colour when aligned parallel to the slow axis (negative elongation)
  • ➤ In gouty arthritis, the classic finding on synovial fluid analysis is: Needle-shaped crystals Negatively birefringent under polarized light Show yellow colour when aligned parallel to the slow axis (negative elongation)
  • ➤ In gouty arthritis, the classic finding on synovial fluid analysis is:
  • ➤ Needle-shaped crystals Negatively birefringent under polarized light Show yellow colour when aligned parallel to the slow axis (negative elongation)
  • ➤ Needle-shaped crystals
  • ➤ Negatively birefringent under polarized light
  • ➤ Show yellow colour when aligned parallel to the slow axis (negative elongation)
  • ➤ These crystals are composed of monosodium urate. Quick Crystal Comparison:
  • ➤ These crystals are composed of monosodium urate.

questions.text: A 53-year-old female presented with complaints of knee pain for past 6 months. She adds that pain is aggravated mostly whenever she sits after performing household work. On examination by orthopedic doctor, there was not only tenderness but also needle-shaped crystals with negative bifringence under microscopic examination of synovial fluids. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male presents with a painful swollen ankle after landing awkwardly during a soccer game. Physical examination reveals tenderness over the lateral malleolus and a positive anterior drawer test. What is the likely injury?
A 30-year-old male cyclist presents with wrist pain after a fall onto an outstretched hand. An X-ray shows a fracture of the scaphoid. What is the most appropriate initial management?

options.label: D
options.text: Splinting and follow-up in a week

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents with chronic shoulder pain and limited range of motion. Physical examination reveals a positive Neer and Hawkins test. What is the likely diagnosis?
A patient presents with knee pain and a limp. Radiographs showed the following findings. What is the most likely condition?

A 40-year-old male presents with severe heel pain, especially with the first steps in the morning. On examination, there is tenderness at the plantar fascia insertion. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most convenient method for treatment of fracture shaft femur in children less than 2 years of age?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Spica

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Spica Casting is the most appropriate, non-invasive, and convenient method of treatment. It provides sufficient immobilization and allows the bone to heal effectively with minimal risk of complications.
  • ➤ Spica Casting is the most appropriate, non-invasive, and convenient method of treatment.
  • ➤ It provides sufficient immobilization and allows the bone to heal effectively with minimal risk of complications.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male presents with sudden onset of severe pain in his big toe, along with redness and swelling. He has a history of hyperuricemia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Supracondylar fracture of the femur commonly injures which of the following structure?
A 25-year-old man presents with wrist pain after falling on an outstretched hand. An X-ray reveals a fracture at the distal radius with dorsal angulation. What is this type of fracture called?
A 35-year-old female presents with pain and tenderness over the lateral aspect of her elbow, which worsens with gripping activities. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Hemiarthroplasty with Austin-Moore prosthesis is done for:

options.label: A
options.text: If patient is > 65 years old with fracture neck of femur

options.label: B
options.text: If patient is < 65 years old with fracture neck of femur

questions.correct_answer: A. If patient is > 65 years old with fracture neck of femur
questions.explanation: Ans. A) If patient is > 65 years old with fracture neck of femur

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy presents with knee pain and a prominent tibial tuberosity. He plays soccer and has noticed worsening pain with activity. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Injury to which region may result in paraplegia?
Tardy ulnar nerve palsy is commonly seen in:

A 28-year-old male presents with lower back pain radiating down his left leg. He reports numbness and tingling in the left foot. Physical examination reveals positive straight leg raise test. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented to the emergency department after falling on an outstretched hand. On examination, dinner fork deformity can be noticed. What can be a probable diagnosis?
A 30-year-old male presents with hip pain and a limp after running long distances. Physical examination reveals a positive Trendelenburg sign. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Knuckle-Bender splint is used for:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ulnar nerve injury

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • :
  • • Option A. Median nerve injury. In median nerve injury, wrist splint is more commonly used. Knuckle bender can also be used, but not commonly than a wrist splint.
  • • Option A. Median nerve injury.
  • • Option B. Radial nerve injury. For radial nerve injury, a cock-up splint is used.
  • • Option B. Radial nerve injury.
  • • Option D. Erb’s palsy. In brachial plexus injury, aeroplane splint is used.
  • • Option D. Erb’s palsy.
  • • Educational objective:
  • • Educational objective:
  • • The knuckle bender splint is used commonly for ulnar nerve injury more than median nerve injury.
  • • The knuckle bender splint is used commonly for ulnar nerve injury more than median nerve injury.

questions.text: A 20-year-old male patient presents with a 2-month history of severe pain in his right foot. Physical examination reveals a limited range of motion and a positive Thompson's test. Radiographs show the following. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following nerves is most commonly damaged in the injury shown in the radiograph given below?
What is the surgical procedure done to repair a torn meniscus in the peripheral one-third region?
Name the procedure done to treat a herniated disc?
Identify the bone marked in the given foot radiograph.
All of the following are true about rickets except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Hypertonia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypertonia is not typically associated with this condition. Rickets primarily involves issues with bone mineralization and growth, leading to deformities and characteristic signs, but not increased muscle tone.
  • ➤ Hypertonia is not typically associated with this condition.
  • ➤ Rickets primarily involves issues with bone mineralization and growth, leading to deformities and characteristic signs, but not increased muscle tone.

questions.text: A 20-year-old male sustains a gunshot wound to the right humerus, resulting in a segmental fracture. What is the most appropriate treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Conservative management with antibiotics and pain medication

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediate surgical debridement and fixation

questions.text: What is the most common congenital deformity of the lower limb?

A 30-year-old patient presented after a motor vehicle accident to the emergency. On examination, the right lower limb was longer than the left, abducted and externally rotated. What can be the likely diagnosis? (FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Anterior hip dislocation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The limb appears lengthened and in FABER (flexion, abduction, external rotation) deformity in anterior dislocation of the hip following a motor vehicle accident. Thus, in the given scenario, the patient has anterior dislocation of the hip.
  • ➤ The limb appears lengthened and in FABER (flexion, abduction, external rotation) deformity in anterior dislocation of the hip following a motor vehicle accident.
  • ➤ Thus, in the given scenario, the patient has anterior dislocation of the hip.

questions.text: Identify the structure pointed in the anatomical snuffbox. (FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Extensor pollicis longus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The marked muscle tendon the given image is of the extensor pollicis longus in the anatomical snuffbox. It forms the medial boundary of the snuffbox and functions to extend the thumb.
  • ➤ The marked muscle tendon the given image is of the extensor pollicis longus in the anatomical snuffbox.
  • ➤ It forms the medial boundary of the snuffbox and functions to extend the thumb.

questions.text: Identify the classification used and grade of the shown injury in a child. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Gartland’s classification Type III

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Gartland classification is specifically used for supracondylar humerus fractures in children, while the Salter-Harris classification is used for growth plate (epiphyseal) fractures.
  • ➤ Gartland classification
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification
  • ➤ Gartland classification Supracondylar humerus
  • ➤ Gartland classification Supracondylar humerus
  • ➤ Type 1: Undisplaced Type 2: Displaced with posterior hinge intact Type 3a: Displaced fracture with lateral hinge broken (PM) Type 3b: Displaced fracture with medial hinge broken (PL) Type 4: Completely displaced with both anterior and posterior periosteum avulsed (Intra-operative finding)
  • ➤ Type 1: Undisplaced
  • ➤ Type 2: Displaced with posterior hinge intact
  • ➤ Type 3a: Displaced fracture with lateral hinge broken (PM)
  • ➤ Type 3b: Displaced fracture with medial hinge broken (PL)
  • ➤ Type 4: Completely displaced with both anterior and posterior periosteum avulsed (Intra-operative finding)
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification of epiphyseal injuries
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification of epiphyseal injuries
  • ➤ Type I: Fracture line is entirely with in Physis causing epiphyseal slip Type II: Fracture line extends from physis into the Metaphysis (Thurston-Holland’s fragment sign) Type III: Fracture line extends from physis into the Epiphysis causing epiphyseal split Type IV: Fracture line extends across the Epiphysis, (articular surface), Physis, and metaphysis Type V: Crush injury of physis with initially normal X-rays
  • ➤ Type I: Fracture line is entirely with in Physis causing epiphyseal slip
  • ➤ Type II: Fracture line extends from physis into the Metaphysis (Thurston-Holland’s fragment sign)
  • ➤ Type III: Fracture line extends from physis into the Epiphysis causing epiphyseal split
  • ➤ Type IV: Fracture line extends across the Epiphysis, (articular surface), Physis, and metaphysis
  • ➤ Type V: Crush injury of physis with initially normal X-rays
